Name: Pillar
Description: This pillar in limestone comes from the excavations of W. F. Petrie at Sedment el-Gebel, one of the necropoleis of Herakleopolis Magna. It was part of a series of six pillars from the tomb of Seti. This person, who is not known by any other sources, was "royal scribe and officer and chief of the followers of the Lord of the Two Lands". The pillar bears on each side a column of text containing an offering formula in favour of the deceased. Seti probably lived under the reign of Ramesses II.
